alert.note: Alert for East Central Plains (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Red Flag Warning issued January 10 at 2:21PM MST until January 10 at 5:00PM MST by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT THROUGH 5 PM MST TODAY FOR THE EAST CENTRAL PLAINS DUE TO STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH IN EFFECT WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON FOR THE NORTHEAST PLAINS, EAST CENTRAL PLAINS AND CENTRAL HIGHLANDS DUE TO VERY STRONG WINDS AND LOW HUMIDITY... .Strong winds will combine with low humidity and well above normal temperatures to bring a few hours of critical fire weather conditions to the east central plains this afternoon. Strong to damaging winds will hit much of eastern New Mexico Wednesday and will combine with low humidity to bring more widespread critical conditions to the central highlands, northeast plains and east central plains. ...RED FLAG WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM MST THIS AFTERNOON... ...FIRE WEATHER WATCH REMAINS IN EFFECT FROM WEDNESDAY MORNING THROUGH WEDNESDAY AFTERNOON... * AREA AND TIMING...East central plains this afternoon and again on Wednesday. * 20 FOOT WINDS...West 20 to 30 mph with gusts to 40 mph this afternoon. West 35 to 45 mph with gusts to 65 mph on Wednesday. * RELATIVE HUMIDITY...12 to 16 percent this afternoon and 14 to 18 percent on Wednesday. * IMPACTS...Any fires that develop will likely spread rapidly. Outdoor burning is not recommended.
info.instruction: Please advise the appropriate officials or fire crews in the field of this Red Flag Warning and Fire Weather Watch.
